speaker: THERSITES
text: Now they are clapper-clawing one another.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I’ll go look on. That dissembling abominable varlet,

speaker: THERSITES
text: Diomed, has got that same scurvy doting foolish

speaker: THERSITES
text: young knave’s sleeve of Troy there in his helm.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I would fain see them meet, that that same young

speaker: THERSITES
text: Trojan ass that loves the whore there might send

speaker: THERSITES
text: that Greekish whoremasterly villain with the sleeve

speaker: THERSITES
text: back to the dissembling luxurious drab, of a sleeveless

speaker: THERSITES
text: errand. O’ th’ t’other side, the policy of those

speaker: THERSITES
text: crafty swearing rascals—that stale old mouse-eaten

speaker: THERSITES
text: dry cheese, Nestor, and that same dog-fox,

speaker: THERSITES
text: Ulysses—is proved not worth a blackberry. They

speaker: THERSITES
text: set me up, in policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax, against

speaker: THERSITES
text: that dog of as bad a kind, Achilles. And now is the

speaker: THERSITES
text: cur Ajax prouder than the cur Achilles, and will

speaker: THERSITES
text: not arm today, whereupon the Grecians begin to

speaker: THERSITES
text: proclaim barbarism, and policy grows into an ill

speaker: THERSITES
text: opinion.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Soft! Here comes sleeve and t’ other.

speaker: TROILUS
text:
Fly
               
              not
              ,
               
              for
               
              shouldst
               
              thou
               
              take
               
              the
               
              river
               
              Styx

speaker: TROILUS
text:
I
               
              would
               
              swim
               
              after
              .

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
Thou
               
              dost
               
              miscall
               
              retire
              .

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
I
               
              do
               
              not
               
              fly
              ,
               
              but
               
              advantageous
               
              care

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
Withdrew
               
              me
               
              from
               
              the
               
              odds
               
              of
               
              multitude
              .

speaker: DIOMEDES
text:
Have
               
              at
               
              thee
              !

speaker: THERSITES
text: Hold thy whore, Grecian! Now for thy

speaker: THERSITES
text: whore, Trojan! Now the sleeve, now the sleeve!

speaker: HECTOR
text:
What
               
              art
               
              thou
              ,
               
              Greek
              ?
               
              Art
               
              thou
               
              for
               
              Hector’s
               
              match
              ?

speaker: HECTOR
text:
Art
               
              thou
               
              of
               
              blood
               
              and
               
              honor
              ?

speaker: THERSITES
text: No, no, I am a rascal, a scurvy railing

speaker: THERSITES
text: knave, a very filthy rogue.

speaker: HECTOR
text: I do believe thee. Live.

speaker: THERSITES
text: God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me!

speaker: THERSITES
text: But a plague break thy neck for frighting me!

speaker: THERSITES
text: What’s become of the wenching rogues? I think

speaker: THERSITES
text: they have swallowed one another. I would laugh at

speaker: THERSITES
text: that miracle—yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself. I’ll

speaker: THERSITES
text: seek them.
